question.title: Why the error "package org.apache.flink.api.common.eventtime does not exist" is produced
question.body:
I am compiling a java project that uses maven to manage the project. The java version is 17.0.16

I included the following dependency inside the dependencies section (i.e. ...)

<dependency>
   <groupId>org.apache.flink</groupId>
   <artifactId>flink-core</artifactId>
   <version>1.20.0</version>
</dependency>

When mvn compile command is executed the following error occurs:

[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR :
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[3,45] package org.apache.flink.api.common.eventtime does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[4,49] package org.apache.flink.api.common.serialization does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[5,47] package org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.source does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[6,70] package org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.source.enumerator.initializer does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[7,45] package org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.sink does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[8,45] package org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.sink does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[9,49] package org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[10,50] package org.apache.flink.streaming.api.environment does not exist
[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[16,15] cannot find symbol
  symbol:   class StreamExecutionEnvironment
  location: class com.radar.bridge_kafka.KafkaStringCopier

The first 16 lines of the class KafkaStringCopier are the following:

package com.radar.bridge_kafka;

import org.apache.flink.api.common.eventtime.WatermarkStrategy;
import org.apache.flink.api.common.serialization.SimpleStringSchema;
import org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.source.KafkaSource;
import org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.source.enumerator.initializer.OffsetsInitializer;
import org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.sink.KafkaSink;
import org.apache.flink.connector.kafka.sink.KafkaRecordSerializationSchema;
import org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream.DataStream;
import org.apache.flink.streaming.api.environment.StreamExecutionEnvironment;

public class KafkaStringCopier {

    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        // Set up the execution environment
        final StreamExecutionEnvironment env = StreamExecutionEnvironment.getExecutionEnvironment();

The class org.apache.flink.api.common.eventtime.WatermarkStrategy is included in the file "flink-core-1.20.0.jar".

Any help is really appreciated.

I tried mvn compile command and many errors occurs. The first error that occurred was:

[ERROR] /home/rdelarosa/flink/pry_flink/pry-flink-1_20-kafka/bridge_kafka/src/main/java/com/radar/bridge_kafka/KafkaStringCopier.java:[3,45] package org.apache.flink.api.common.eventtime does not exist

I expect that this error doesn't occur.

question_comments.body: There are other dependencies you need. Take a look at github.com/confluentinc/flink-cookbook/blob/master/… for an example.
Maybe the jar is corrupted. Delete it from your local Maven cache and try again.
